experience.title: Undergraduate Researcher
experience.description: â€¢ Performed literature review, with specific focus on Capsule Neural Networks and Analog Weather Forecasting.â€¢ Used surface temperature (T2m) and geopotential height at 500 mbar (Z500) (from the NCAR CESM-LENS datatset) to make analogous predictions of the onset of heat/cold waves over North America, 1-5 days ahead.â€¢ Observed that CapsNets outperformed CNNs and logistic regression; confirmed trends observed in the paper â€˜Analog Forecasting of Extreme-Causing Weather Patterns Using Deep Learningâ€™ (2020, Chattopadhyay et al.)

experience.title: Participant: National Science (VIJYOSHI) Camp - 2017
experience.description: Vijyoshi is an annual national science camp in India organised by KVPY in collaboration with INSPIRE programme, IISc Bangalore and IISER-Kolkata. It is an abbreviation for "Vigyan Jyoti Shivir". It started in the year 2009 and is funded by the Department of Science and Technology (Government of India). The aim of Vijyoshi Camp is to provide a forum for interactions between bright young students and leading researchers in various branches of Science and Mathematics.

projects.title: Facial Expression Recognition with Keras
projects.description: â€¢ Build and train a convolutional neural network (CNN) in Keras from scratch to recognize facial expressions.â€¢ Using the FER 2013 Dataset to classify each face into one of seven categories (0=Angry, 1=Disgust, 2=Fear, 3=Happy, 4=Sad, 5=Surprise, 6=Neutral).â€¢ Use OpenCV to automatically detect faces in images and draw bounding boxes around them.â€¢ Train, save, and export the CNN.â€¢ Directly serve the trained model to a web interface and perform real-time facial expression recognition on video and image data.

projects.title: Image De-noising Using Auto-Encoders in Keras and Python
projects.description: â€¢ Understand the theory and intuition behind Autoencodersâ€¢ Import Key libraries, dataset and visualize imagesâ€¢ Perform image normalization, pre-processing, and add random noise to imagesâ€¢ Build an Autoencoder using Keras with Tensorflow 2.0 as a backendâ€¢ Compile and fit Autoencoder model to training data â€¢ Assess the performance of trained Autoencoder using various KPIs

projects.title: Image Super Resolution Using Auto-Encoders in Keras
projects.description: Use Keras with Tensorflow as its backend to train an autoencoder. Use this deep learning powered autoencoder to significantly enhance the quality of images. That is, the neural network will create high-resolution images from low-res source images.

projects.title: parkMyCar
projects.description: Developed in 24 hours at Microsoft presents Innovation Hackathon, an initiative of IncubateIND, powered by Microsoft Azure.Provides real-time parking space availability, also enables you to list personal space for parking.
